intro: Crassula andicola, commonly known as the Andes crassula, is a succulent plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and fleshy, thick leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its slow growth and ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a decorative plant in both indoor and outdoor settings.
